bitfield.description: 3G Identification Value
3G RTL Version Value
3G Major Version Value
3G Minor Version Value
DLR enable

bitenum.description: DLR is enabled. DLR packets be moved to destination port transmit queue priority 3 and will be separated out onto dlr_cpdma_ch when packet is to egress on port 0.
DLR is disabled. DLR packets will not be moved to queue priority 3 and will not be separated out onto dlr_cpdma_ch.

bitfield.description: Port 0 VLAN Encapsulation (egress):

bitenum.description: Port 2 receive packets (from 3G) are VLAN encapsulated.
Port 2 receive packets (from 3G) are not VLAN encapsulated.

bitfield.description: VLAN Aware Mode:

bitenum.description: 3G is in the VLAN aware mode.
3G is in the VLAN unaware mode.

bitfield.description: FIFO Loopback Mode

bitenum.description: FIFO Loopback mode enabled. Each packet received is turned around and sent out on the same port's transmit path. Port 2 receive is fixed on channel zero. The RXSOFOVERRUN statistic will increment for every packet sent in FIFO loopback mode.
Loopback is disabled

bitfield.description: Software reset - Writing a one to this bit causes the 3G logic to be reset. [[br]]After writing a one to this bit, it may be polled to determine if the reset has occurred. [[br]]If a one is read, the reset has not yet occurred. [[br]]If a zero is read then reset has occurred. [[br]]
Port 2 (GMII2 and Port 2 FIFO) Statistics Enable

bitenum.description: Port 2 statistics are enabled.
Port 2 statistics are not enabled.

bitfield.description: Port 1 (GMII1 and Port 1 FIFO) Statistics Enable

bitenum.description: Port 1 statistics are enabled.
Port 1 statistics are not enabled.

bitfield.description: Port 0 Statistics Enable. [[br]]FIFO overruns (SOFOVERRUNS) are the only port 0 statistics that are enabled to be kept. [[br]]

bitenum.description: Port 0 statistics are enabled.
Port 0 statistics are not enabled.

bitfield.description: Port 2 Queue Priority 3 Transmit Shape Enable - If there is only one shaping queue then it must be priority 3. [[br]]
Port 2 Queue Priority 2 Transmit Shape Enable - If there are two shaping queues then they must be priorities 3 and 2. [[br]]
Port 2 Queue Priority 1 Transmit Shape Enable - If there are three shaping queues all three bits should be set. [[br]]
Port 1 Queue Priority 3 Transmit Shape Enable - If there is only one shaping queue then it must be priority 3. [[br]]
Port 1 Queue Priority 2 Transmit Shape Enable- If there are two shaping queues then they must be priorities 3 and 2. [[br]]
Port 1 Queue Priority 1 Transmit Shape Enable- If there are three shaping queues all three bits should be set. [[br]]
Port 2 Priority Type Escalate

bitenum.description: Port 2 priority type escalate Escalate should not be used with queue shaping.
Port 2 priority type fixed

bitfield.description: Port 1 Priority Type Escalate

bitenum.description: Port 1 priority type escalate Escalate should not be used with queue shaping.
Port 1 priority type fixed

bitfield.description: Port 0 Priority Type Escalate

bitenum.description: Port 0 priority type escalate Escalate should not be used with queue shaping.
Port 0 priority type fixed

bitfield.description: Escalate Priority Load Value When a port is in escalate priority, this is the number of higher priority packets sent before the next lower priority is allowed to send a packet. [[br]]Escalate priority allows lower priority packets to be sent at a fixed rate relative to the next higher priority. [[br]]
Software Idle - Setting this bit causes the switch fabric to stop forwarding packets at the next start of packet. [[br]]

CPGMAC_SL Switch FIFO receive through rate. [[br]]This register value is the maximum throughput of the ethernet ports to the crossbar SCR. [[br]]The default is one [[br]]8-byte word for every 3 CLK periods maximum. [[br]]

CPDMA Switch FIFO receive through rate. [[br]]This register value is the maximum throughput of the CPDMA host port to the crossbar SCR. [[br]]The default is one [[br]]8-byte word for every 3 CLK periods maximum. [[br]]
CPGMAC_SL Short Gap Threshold - This is the CPGMAC_SL associated FIFO transmit block usage value for triggering TX_SHORT_GAP. [[br]]

FIFO Packet Transmit (egress) Start Words. [[br]]This value is the number of required packet words in the transmit FIFO before the packet egress will begin. [[br]]This value is non-zero to preclude underrun. [[br]]Decimal 32 is the recommended value. [[br]]It should not be increased unnecessairly to prevent adding to the switch latency. [[br]]
Port 2 Receive flow control enable
Port 1 Receive flow control enable
Port 0 Receive flow control enable
Time Sync VLAN LTYPE2 This VLAN LTYPE value is used for tx and rx. [[br]]This is the inner VLAN if both are present. [[br]]
Time Sync VLAN LTYPE1 This VLAN LTYPE value is used for tx and rx. [[br]]This is the outer VLAN if both are present. [[br]]
Time Sync LTYPE2 This is an Ethertype value to match for tx and rx time sync packets.
Time Sync LTYPE1 This is an ethertype value to match for tx and rx time sync packets.
DLR LTYPE
Port 2 Transmit FIFO Empty

bitenum.description: The port 2 transmit FIFO is empty. The packet can still be in transmission, but when set this bit indicates that there are no full packets in the transmit FIFO.
There are packet(s) in the port 2 transmit FIFO.

bitfield.description: Port 1 Transmit FIFO Empty

bitenum.description: The port 1 transmit FIFO is empty. The packet can still be in transmission, but when set this bit indicates that there are no full packets in the transmit FIFO.
There are packet(s) in the port 1 transmit FIFO.

bitfield.description: Port 0 Transmit FIFO Empty

bitenum.description: The port 2 transmit FIFO is empty. The packet can still be in transmission, but when set this bit indicates that there are no full packets in the transmit FIFO.
There are packet(s) in the port 2 transmit FIFO.
